page.title: 16THE MISS NASH INTERVIEW
page.content: We visited Miss Nash,late Headmistress of Spencer Girl's School,who has lived in the St.James area all her life.She told us that she had seen very many changes take place.She told us that at one time there were no buses only trams into the town centre,and you could get there more quickly than you can today. The area used to have an Ice Rink,which later became one of the town's nine cinemas-we now haveÂ£one'triple cinema only.People in those days seemed more friendly and had time for each other-it was much more of a community, centered around the local church,chapel,school, and shoe factory.On hot summer evenings people used to sit outside and chat to each other the streets were safe for children to play in while parents could keep an eye on them.Now there is only one shoe factory,hardly anyone goes to church,and people lock their doors.
